definition: Baoji prefecture-level city in Shaanxi/called Chencang 陳倉|陈仓[Chen2 cang1] in ancient times
chicken ribs/sth of little value or interest/sth of dubious worth that one is reluctant to give up/to be physically weak
chicken stock/chicken soup/(fig.) chicken soup for the soul – i.e. feel-good motivational stories (often used disparagingly because the stories don't really effect change in people's lives)
chicken raised for meat/broiler/(computing) zombie/infected computer in a botnet
Baoji prefecture-level city in Shaanxi/called Chencang 陳倉|陈仓[Chen2 cang1] in ancient times

sentences.english: When the chicken crow, follow the chicken.
sentences.chinese: 雞叫的時候，你就跟着雞走。

sentences.english: We begin the year with a grey fowl from Quy Nhon.
sentences.chinese: 我們開始了一年的灰色雞從阮貴部門官員。

sentences.english: A method for preparing chicken erythrocyte membranes in the form of small vesicles has been described.
sentences.chinese: 敘述了一種以囊泡形式製取雞紅細胞膜的方法。

sentences.english: The situation is described as a " chicken-and-egg thing".
sentences.chinese: 這種情況被描述成“雞和蛋的問題”。

sentences.english: We dined on chicken, potatoes, salad and apple-pie.
sentences.chinese: 正餐我們喫的是雞，土豆，涼拌菜和蘋果餡餅。

sentences.english: Don't go getting so uppity even if you is the last chicken in Atlanta.
sentences.chinese: 不要那麼自大，就算你是亞特蘭的最後一隻雞。

sentences.english: The Eimeria species, causative agents of the disease coccidiosis, are genetically complex protozoan parasites endemic in poultry.
sentences.chinese: 雞球蟲病是嚴重危害養禽業的一種寄生蟲病。

sentences.english: Serve with red meat, chicken, duck, goose and game.
sentences.chinese: 適合搭配紅肉，雞，鴨，鵝，野味。

sentences.english: Chicken and lychee, together is the "auspicious" means.
sentences.chinese: 雞與荔枝，合起來就是“吉利”的意思。

sentences.english: We consider this nucleus as the spinal accessory nucleus of the chicken.
sentences.chinese: 筆者認爲此細胞柱應爲雞的副神經核。

sentences.english: A donation makes the cat cluck like a chicken.
sentences.chinese: 捐一筆錢便能讓這隻貓像雞那樣的咯咯叫。

sentences.english: He wants to feed off the chickens you gave him.
sentences.chinese: 他想把你給他的雞養肥。

sentences.english: Put the hens in a second pot of water, bring to a boil.
sentences.chinese: 把雞放在第二個裝水的鍋裏煮。

sentences.english: We keep a few fowls and some goats.
sentences.chinese: 我們養了幾隻雞和一些山羊。

sentences.english: I think you cooked this chicken too long. It tastes really dry.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲你煮雞煮得太久了，嚐起來真的好乾。

head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
